Package com.android

Class Human

java.lang.Object
com.android.Human
public class Human
extends Object
Local Inner classes these are classes that are created inside a method or any curly bracket structure (besides a class) they do NOT HAVE an access modifer, as they are the same level as a local variable and local variables do not have access modifers (only final is allowed) they CANNOT be declared static or have static methods or fields, regardless of whether they are in a static method or not, however they can access static members of the enclosing class. they DO NOT have access to local variables of a method UNLESS they are FINAL or EFFECTIVELY FINAL To see video tutorial for this section of code Video tutorial For all 177 videos, which cover all the topics in this course go to Complete Course Video Tutorial

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) int age  
    (package private) static int catCounter
    inside the inner local Cat class this will be incremented to give each cat a unique Cat id
    (package private) static int humanCounter  
    (package private) String name  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Human()
    if you place a class inside of a body {}, be that a initialiser, constructor or a method, this is a local inner class this constructor has a local inner class Cat

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) void eat()
    eat method of the Human class we have an inner Digest local class in this method whihc means we can only create a Digest object inside of the eat() method

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
